area_name: Last of the Mohicans, Left Wall

content.description: A clean and obvious line up the bolts. The idea of an escape hatch to the right might inspire additional boldness; I am eager to get back on this and hopefully demonstrate a little more grace having seen some consensus on grade as I thought it was more difficult.
content.protection: Quickdraws, personal preference for bolted anchor
content.location: Right line of the left most wall

content.description: Crux is low and delicate with an enjoyable and well protected journey to the anchor (or beyond!). Can be led with a light rack of quickdraws; a minimal rack affords a nice anchor above the fixed anchor and a chance to relax and enjoy the view from a comfortable ledge. The start is a bit more committing than it looks.
content.protection: Quickdraws, gear or preference for the bolted anchor
content.location: The left line of the left one of the 3 walls in this area

content.description: Start is deceptively hard (did not red point). When I discovered signs of recent dev, I GPS'd it as 'someone's secret bolt garden' and gave it a shot lead solo before being able to find any details. I guessed it was a camp or school attempting to protect some easy lines. I was VERY wrong and was rejected harshly only to then embarrass myself before the sun as a witness by trying to swing in from the lines right and left. That said, very nice after the low crux.
content.protection: Quickdraws, personal preference for anchor bolts.

pathTokens: Last of the Mohicans, Left Wall

content.description: Of the 3 walls, this is the first off the trail as you arrive, furthest to the climber's left with 3 short and well-bolted sport lines ending at fixed anchors (~5.9/5.10)
